headline: Walmart defeats shareholder lawsuit over opioid probe disclosures
summary: (Reuters) -Walmart defeated an appeal by shareholders who said the world's largest retailer defrauded them by failing to disclose that federal prosecutors were investigating its opioid-dispensing practices.  The 3rd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in Philadelphia said Walmart did not commit securities fraud by waiting until June 2018 to reveal it was being investigated, 1-1/2 years after the probe began and 10 weeks after a Texas prosecutor warned she intended to indict the company.  Walmart learned of the opioid probe after federal agents raided one of its stores, seeking records concerning two Texas doctors who were prescribing vast amounts of the painkillers.

headline: Affirm Stock Soars 21% After Earnings. Why Wall Street Is Excited.
summary: Revenue rose 33% to $876 million, handily topping the $837 million analysts had anticipated, according to FactSet.  Gross merchandise volume, a key metric representing the total dollar amount of all transactions on the platform, net of refunds, was up 43% at $10.4 billion.  The figure was also up sequentially;  Affirm  reported $8.6 billion in GMV in the previous quarter.

headline: Affirm Stock Soars After Earnings. Why Wall Street Is Excited.
summary: Shares of  Affirm Holdings  continued their ascent in premarket trading Friday after the fintech posted solid fiscal fourth-quarter earnings.  Revenue rose 33% to $876 million, handily topping the $837 million analysts had anticipated, according to FactSet.  Gross merchandise volume, a key metric representing the total dollar amount of all transactions on the platform, net of refunds, was up 43% at $10.4 billion.

headline: Affirm shares climb as resilient consumer spending drives strong annual forecast
summary: (Reuters) -Affirm Holdings' shares jumped in premarket trading on Friday, as the company's strong annual forecast for gross merchandise value, driven by resilient consumer spending, eased concerns over its growth after Walmart's impending exit.  In early 2025, Walmart  said it would end its six-year-old payments partnership with the buy-now-pay-later firm, with the retail behemoth gradually shifting to its Swedish rival Klarna.  Affirm forecast fiscal year 2026 gross merchandise value (GMV) - the total dollar amount of all transactions on its platform - to be more than $46 billion, above analysts' consensus of $45.67 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

Affirm forecast fiscal year 2026 gross merchandise value (GMV) - the total dollar amount of all transactions on its platform - to be more than $46 billion, above analysts' consensus of $45.67 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: What Does Ending Price Matching Mean for Target Stock in 2025?
summary: Thinking about what to do with your Target stock lately? You are definitely not alone. Over the past year, Target has been on a bit of a roller coaster, closing most recently at $96.81. In fact, the stock is down 34.5% over the last twelve months, and 29.4% since the start of the year. Those numbers do not lie, and it is natural to wonder if there is more pain ahead or if now could be the buying opportunity investors wait for. Much of this recent volatility goes back to persistent worries...
